paragraphs.1: Decides to proclaim 10 May as the International Day of Argania, to be observed annually;
paragraphs.2: Invites all Member States, organizations and agencies of the United Nations system, other international and regional organizations and civil society organizations, non-governmental organizations, academic institutions, the private sector, individuals and other relevant stakeholders to observe the International Day of Argania, as appropriate;
paragraphs.3: Invites all relevant stakeholders to continue to give due consideration to enhancing international cooperation in support of the efforts to preserve Argania, given its vital role in maintaining ecological balance and preserving biodiversity;
paragraphs.4: Invites the Department of Global Communications of the United Nations Secretariat, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, the World Health Organization, the United Nations Development Programme and the United Nations Environment Programme to facilitate the observance of the International Day of Argania, mindful of the provisions contained in the annex to Economic and Social Council resolution 1980/67;
paragraphs.5: Stresses that the cost of all activities that may arise from the implementation of the present resolution should be met from voluntary contributions, including from the private sector;
paragraphs.6: Requests the Secretary-General to bring the present resolution to the attention of all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and civil society organizations for appropriate observance.
